text: Très sympathique café de la rue St-Hubert, les smoothies sont excellents, et la terrasse y est très agréable.

I've been back to Candide several times, and on most occasions, I've noticed the owners sitting outside on their terrace, often with friends, while they're on shift. I know running a cafe is hard work, and I've got nothing against anyone taking a break. Still, I was feeling discomfited by this behaviour, though it took me a while to figure out how to explain why. Basically, this behaviour makes the owners feel less like hosts and more like guests. If they're doing this when you want something, you either break in and feel like you're "imposing" yourself on them, or you wait--neither of which is an appealing option. And this is coming from a "pushy" American. Both owners are very friendly, but this is unprofessional enough that I'm taking one star off my review.

Found the perfect café close to home! 

My friend showed us this coffee shop and I wish I had known about this place before, I could've spent days studying here! The café is definitely a nice spot to wind down with friends or work on your stuff. There's even a library with this only rule: you have to leave a book for each book you take with you, which I think is simply wonderful. There's beautiful art hanging on the walls and it just looks like home all around you.
Un incontournable de la Plaza! Confortable, chaleureux, mon café préféré du coin! Service très sympathique et professionnel! On se sent comme chez soi!
L'endroit sympa pour un thé un café un smoothies ou grignoter. Le design est très Chill et relax et le personnel vraiment cool et souriant

Candide Café was a nice getaway when it started raining. It's a very bright café and has a warm environment. You can do work, chat with friends, or just people watch. There's plenty of tables or a little bar if you're a solo visitor but there's plenty of tables as well. The staff was friendly and are happy to speak English or French. I ordered a Caramel Mike. The small is quite large actually. It was enjoyable. I had a double chocolate cookie to boot which was decent. It's a great atmosphere! Highly recommend on the Montréal coffee scene!

Location: Tucked away in Plaza St. Hubert. Street parking is available [metered]. For some reason, people don't seem to have issues finding a parking spot here but they might just be lucky. 

The place: Small café with a few tables, and bar-seating area by the front window. For those of you who know about my obsession with street art, you won't be surprised when I tell you how delighted I was to find an amazing mural on the main wall, courtesy of one of Montreal's top crews. Bonus!

The goods: Coffee and a few baked goods. I forgot to ask the barista which beans they use, but this issue was quickly resolved when my fellow coffee-lover and Yelper Khai, messaged me to discuss the bean situation. These guys use Kittle beans, and truth be told, I bought a bag last year and wasn't a fan. Despite buying an Espresso roast (or some kind of dark roast - I forget), I found the coffee to be too weak for my tastes. I am happy to report that the folk at Candide make a kickass Macchiato with said beans, and I was pleasantly surprised when I found out they were using Kittle. I put their Macchiato on par with Code Black (they don't use Kittle), which is my #1 place for coffee served in tiny cups. 

Service: Friendly.

Price point: I think the Macchiato was $3.15.

After a good walk on the plaza, I needed a place to take some caffeine, recharge my phone and wifi. 

After ordering a rose latté, plugging, enter the wifi and took my first sip. I relaxed instantly.

The place has a cool, let-it-be vibe not so hipster, not so formal. Yes I saw somebody with a mason jar get in. But, I feel that somebody from Dracolite* could come here without having anyone raising an eyebrow.

The downside was my rose latté. The flower just tasted bitter to me. It was still ok, but I would have done without the flower. I was picturing something more "loukoum". 

The washrooms are clean and easily accessible and the terrasse is quite nice.

*search creation Dracolite, a neighbouring boutique.

It's a cool place in theory. But I ordered a sandwich and it took them like 20 minutes to make it and then served it to me super burnt. The veggies inside my sandwich turned into mush from being so overcooked. I don't understand... there was hardly any other clients in the place. Not sure why they couldn't handle making one sandwich.

Un propriétaire super sympa, des boissons chaudes délicieuses, un choix de petites pâtisseries a mourir . 
Un bon espace si tu veux venir étudier , tables espacées et aussi grandes, des prises bien disposées, et surtout c'est clair et aéré !
Sans oublier cette magnifique musique de fond, assez calme pour étudier ou l'avoir en fond de parlotte

Anne-marie - Excellent café froid au caramel et lait d'amande !! Yummmm


Maddie- Vraiment bon Smoothie - Très Rafraîchissant comme il fait chaud!

C'est nouveau et c'est beau! J'ai visité le Candide quelques jours après son ouverture et il y a eu une super évolution depuis. Beau décor (vous pouvez dessiner votre propre mouton à la craie sur un mur, trop cool!), grande quantité de livres disponibles pour prendre une pause en se cultivant (d'ailleurs vous pouvez en amener un de votre bibliothèque personnelle pour échanger), possibilité de profiter de la terrasse en été ou d'un banc avec vue sur l'extérieur lorsqu'il fait plus froid. Vous pouvez ainsi juger tous les gens qui se promènent dans ce coin de la Plaza. 

Ils servaient du Kittel la dernière fois que je suis allée. J'ai bien aimé mon latte amande, sans le trouver exceptionnel toutefois, comparativement au proprio qui offre toujours un excellent service, tout comme sa complice au comptoir. Merci de l'accueil chaleureux, je donnerai très certainement une autre chance au café puisqu'il fait bon prendre une pause au Candide!
New favourite spot. Lots of place to sit and read, enjoy the sun and a delicious muffin while sipping on the best coffee.

Coté ambiance . ça vise juste ! 
Autant dans le décor que dans le style de l'endroit, on sent le côtè personnel et funky des propriétaires et de leurs enployés. 
Coté service, le personnel est très gentil et on tombe régulièrement sur les deux propriétaires qui connaissent l'art du café comme pas deux. 
pour ce qui est des cafés, le choix est judicieux et l'offre est originale. 

CONSEIL : essayez le chaï, fait maison, loin du sucré commercial d'un café ordinaire. 

Si vous êtes plus que deux, oubliez l'idée de vous asseoir. l'endroit est très petit et souvent très occupé, donc on prend pour emporter !

I. Love. This. Café. Their olive and mozzarella Panini is literally the highlight of my weekend. They serve great coffee and amazing pastries as well. Very friendly staff, and there's usually space to work, unless they're super busy. Kid-friendly as well. One of my favorites!

Second cafe I went and I was not disappointed! I went there several times to study and do homework with my friend and it's so calm and cozy. The owner of the cafe is really sweet and always wears a big smile on his face. Lovely cafe!

Nouveau café qui vient tout juste d'ouvrir sur une plazza qui se cherche (et se trouve) un nouveau visage.
Des produits locaux, une salle lumineuse et une jeune equipe très agréable !
Café, thé, smoothies et de quoi combler les petites faims.
Miaam !
